== Who I am ==

My name is Roxana Nicolescu and I joined the Kernel Team in January 2023. I mainly help prepare packages for stable releases and solve the bugs that appear along the way. 
I got my bachelorâ€™s degree in Automatic Control and Computer Engineering from Politehnica Bucuresti in 2019.
 
During my studies, I was involved in a unikernel project called Unikraft (https://github.com/unikraft/unikraft) that introduced me to kernel development and virtualization. I also got the opportunity to learn about the Linux kernel along the way and even be a TA in one of our classes later on.
Between graduation and Canonical I worked in fintech for a bit over 2 years, but I never fully enjoyed it and decided to go back and explore the unlimited possibilities in the Linux kernel world. 

== My Ubuntu story ==

Ubuntu (15.10) was my first Linux distribution. I tried it during my first week in university in 2015. I remember I struggled to make a dual boot installation because for some reason, I was unable to partition properly the disk and I ended up erasing my old OS and keeping Ubuntu. This made me use Linux full-time for everything and made my transition to this world smooth. I ended up with a dual boot in the end(after I got smarter) but kept using Ubuntu for most of my activities.
Over the years I played with different flavors and DE but I always stayed in the Ubuntu ecosystem. I tried Debian at some point for a project and I remember I ran into issues with installing the right wifi driver and Nvidia drivers. With Ubuntu, I never had that issue, which is the reason I love using it.

=== My involvement ===

In the last few months, I have been mainly working with the stable team to deliver SRU releases. This resulted in various tasks along the way, starting with preparing the kernel packages for main kernels but also various derivatives, solving bugs either in the kernels or various (dkms) packages, and solving other small issues related to our tests or packaging scripts. I have also helped a bit with preparing the SRU cycle and managing the mailing list.

=== Activity ===

https://launchpad.net/~roxanan

=== Things I could do better ===

An improvement that will probably never end is managing my time in a better way because I have a tendency to postpone things just because other priorities have interrupted my normal flow.

Another important thing is improving my communication skill and getting more involved in discussions within the team, but also outside.
 
=== Plans for the future ===

Short term, I would like to apply for dkms upload rights because it seems there is always an issue that needs to be fixed that delays the release of our kernels.
 
I would also like to improve our testing infrastructure, mainly how we store and show test results so we can avoid the manual work of checking for new regressions and using that time to actually solve the bugs.

Long term, I would like to gain more knowledge in the kernel space and find an area to contribute to.

=== Upload Rights ===

I'm requesting upload rights for the kernel package set for all active series, which includes all the "linux*" packages.

----
== Comments ==
''If you'd like to comment, but are not the applicant or a sponsor, do it here. Don't forget to sign with `@``SIG``@`.''

=== Stefan Bader (smb) ===

==== General Feedback ====

I reviewed some kernels for Roxana and also looked at other work.
Initially there were some details to be discussed but none of the
recent submissions had anything to complain about.
Tasks are done with consideration and persistence. In case of any-
thing being unclear Roxana reaches out for help. I have no worries
that the new powers would be used without care.
Therefor I am recommending to approve PPU rights for Roxana.

==== Suggestions for Improvement ====

Just as an advice to be careful on adding things to ones plate. And
there is no shame in handing things on within the team if tasks get
too much.

[Shamelessly copied from Andrei's endorsement]
I have not specific suggestion, just my favorite thing of pointing
out that preparing an upload, always look at the new changelog and
think about how much sense this would make to oneself as a user.
This is particularly for the main kernel package but also any other
package where the users will have an option to look at the changes
contained in the *_source.changes file. And we all hate to see
"fixes and improvements" in there.

=== Kleber Souza (kleber-souza) ===
==== General feedback ====
I have reviewed a number of kernels prepared by Roxana and they have all been done with care and attention to details. Roxana is always trying to understand how things work, so if something doesn't happen the way it's expected she always tries to understand the reason and not just let it go and move to the next task. She is also always willing to learn from feedback and from her own experience. I have no doubt that Roxana will continue to prepare kernel updates with care and will look for help when something is not expected. Therefore I'm +1 for granting Roxana per-package-upload rights for kernel packages.

==== Areas of Improvement ====

All the improvements I can think of are the ones that come with time and after hitting enough corner cases.
